page.title: 04Wawne, modern.
page.content:
Modern Wawne is a mixture of old 19th Century houses, farms and chapels, church, a small council and a new private estate. Few residents now work on the land, most commute to either Hull or{Beverley.
There are two shops, (Post Office/ general store, off licence/ grocers), a public house, a garage/ filling station, a school and village Hall.
The village hall provides a thriving social life for both young and old. The church and chapel are regularly attended by a small congregation. Outside the village lies a cricket field and tennis court. A new terminal for gas brought in from the North Sea also lies outside the villge. Buses run to and from the village every hour at peak times.
